resources.string: Historical landmark in Los Angeles, California 90068

The Hollywood Sign is an American landmark and cultural icon overlooking Hollywood, Los Angeles, California. It is situated on Mount Lee, in the Hollywood Hills area of the Santa Monica Mountains. \"HOLLYWOOD\" is spelled out in 45 ft-tall white capital letters and is 350 feet long.

Disneyland Park, originally Disneyland, is the first of two theme parks built at the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim, California, opened on July 17, 1955. It is the only theme park designed and built to completion under the direct supervision of Walt Disney.
100 Universal City Plaza, Universal City, CA 91608

Universal Studios Hollywood is a film studio and theme park in the San Fernando Valley area of Los Angeles County, California. About 70% of the studio lies within the unincorporated county island known as Universal City while the rest lies within the city limits of Los Angeles, California.
2823 S Vermont Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90007

We are a restaurant that showcases the foods of colorful India. Steeped in history and traditions, India combines western and eastern influences with it\'s own strong sense of identity to create one of the world\'s most diverse nations.
Simple spot serves Mexican, Indian and American fare, plus fusion options such as chicken tikka tacos.
The Cat and Fiddle Pub and Restaurant
742 N Highland Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90038
Classic pub grub in a punk rock-influenced British bar, reborn from its original Hollywood location.
189 The Grove Dr, Los Angeles, CA 90036
The Grove is a retail and entertainment complex in Los Angeles, located on parts of the historic Farmers Market.
